result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Jose Rivera Jr

defendant.name: Rivera, Jose, Jr
defendant.address: P.O. Box 31, c/o Kettle Moraine Correctional Institution, Plymouth, WI 53073

records.addlTxt: Appointing Attorney Pablo Galaviz
Hearing on November 28, 2022 at 09:30 am.

9:30 AM; Case called for Hearing.  Defendant Jose Rivera Jr appeared by Zoom video, in custody at Kettle Moraine Correctional.  Attorney Angela Wang in court for Jose Rivera Jr.  Prosecuting attorney Peter Michael Tempelis in court for the State of Wisconsin. All parties have agreed that some may have the hearing conducted remotely. This hearing has met the statutory standards for video conferencing. Court notes Atty. Wang filed a motion to withdraw.  Court confirms with the defendant he is seeking new counsel through the Public Defender's office.  Defendant advises he is asking for new counsel to be appointed through the PD's office.  Court will grant Atty. Wang's Motion to Withdraw as counsel.  Court asks Atty. Wang to make sure the PD's office has new counsel appointed before the next court date.  Court will adjourn for status of counsel in about 45 days.  Defendant to appear by Zoom video from KMCI for the next court date.
Hearing scheduled for November 28, 2022 at 09:30 am.
to withdraw as Counsel signed by Judge Paul F. Reilly 10/12/2022.
Motion to Withdraw and Proposed Order submitted by Atty. Wang.
Hearing on October 12, 2022 at 09:30 am.
Filed by Atty. Wang requesting to have the 8/25/2022 hearing rescheduled.  **Reviewed by Judge Melvin for Branch 7 on 08/22/22 - Okay to reset, request for new date 6-8 weeks out is okay.**
Effective August 1, 2022, this case is assigned to Branch 7 Judicial Vacancy, pursuant to 22-SO-04(67).

Hearing on August 25, 2022 at 09:30 am.
Hearing on August 8, 2022 at 02:30 pm.

10:24 AM; Case called for Hearing.  Attorney Angela Wang in court.   Defendant Jose Rivera did not appear.    District Attorney's Office Law Intern Nikole Kane appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court notes it attempted to have the defendant appear by video from DCI however, the facility had the incorrect start time.  Atty. Wang is ok with proceeding without the defendant present as she will just be requesting another date.  Atty. Wang provides an update, she is asking for another further proceedings date in about 45-60 days.  Court adjourns for further proceedings.  Defendant to appear by video from DCI for the next court date.  Hearing scheduled for August 8, 2022 at 02:30 pm.

Hearing on June 6, 2022 at 10:00 am.

10:17 AM; Case called for Hearing.  Defendant Jose Rivera in court, in custody at WCJ, with attorney Angela Wang.   Abbey Nickolie appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Atty. Wang advises the court of the status of the case, she is still discussing a resolution with the State.  Atty. Wang requests another further proceedings date.  No objections from the State.  Court adjourns for further proceedings.  Hearing scheduled for June 6, 2022 at 10:00 am.
Hearing on April 11, 2022 at 10:00 am.

records.descr: Application for specific judicial assign approved

records.addlTxt:
Of Judge Michael O. Bohren, filed by Attorney Angela Wang in Court.

*** Reviewed by Judge Bohren on 03/01/2022: Approved
Defendant waives his right to a Preliminary Hearing.

09:15 AM Defendant Jose Rivera in court, in custody, with attorney Angela Wang.   Jack A. Pitzo appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defense acknowledges receipt of amended complaint and waives reading of amended complaint.  The Court finds that the Defendants waiver to a preliminary hearing is knowing and voluntary.  Attorney Wang files a motion for substitution of Judge Michael Bohren.  Waive reading of Information.  NOT GUILTY PLEA ENTERED.  Bail remains as fixed.  Clerk's office to schedule a date before the Trial Court once the new Judge has been assigned.
Defendant's Demand for Discovery and Inspection.
records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Defendant

records.addlTxt: Atty. Angela Wang
Preliminary hearing on February 28, 2022 at 09:15 am.

02:24 PM Defendant Jose Rivera in court, in custody.  Christian Farina appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  The defendant states he was re-evaluated by the Public Defender's Office and indicates he is eligible now as he has since lost his job.  Attorney Wang confirms the defendant is eligible for State Public Defender representation.  An attorney will be appointed.  Preliminary Hearing requested.  Preliminary time limits waived.  Bail remains as fixed.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for February 28, 2022 at 09:15 am.
Hearing on January 28, 2022 at 01:00 pm.

03:42 PM Defendant Jose Rivera in court, in custody, with attorney Luis Daniel Gutierrez.  Attorney appears as friend of the court. Christian Farina appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Defense acknowledges receipt of complaint and waives reading of complaint.  
Service admitted/advised of charges and potential penalties.  
Court advises of right to an attorney.  Defendant is not eligible for State Public Defender representation.  The Defendant given the Petition for Court Appointed Counsel paperwork in court.
Attorney Gutierrez requests to set the matter for Status of Counsel, so the SPD can re-evaluate. 
Court tolled time limits for preliminary hearing.  Hearing scheduled for January 28, 2022 at 01:00 pm.
